name: Hotel Alba Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had originally been booked at another hotel in Florence but when we arrived to check in we were told that the hotel was full. Another room had been booked for us at their sister hotel: the Hotel Alba. The Alba turned out to be about 1.5 kms away but in a more central location in Florence and closer to the main train station (about a 5 minute walk). By the way, this train station is probably the ugliest building in Florence. The public areas and the rooms in the hotel are very clean. The room was not large but big enough to be comfortable. There are no views of the city centre from the hotel so you want to get out and walk around to see the sites. The staff was polite but did not seem knowledgeable about the local attractions, restos or shopping. In general, this hotel reminded me of a regular 3-star North American chain hotel. It lacked the individual charm of many other hotels in Italy.
reviews.title: Hotel switch in Florence

likes.liked: — Near the train station and attractions
likes.disliked: — The lack of information available at the front desk

reviews.text: On a travel note, we were very disappointed with the Uffizi gallery. The entrance fee is expensive, the line-ups are staggering and the information about exhibits, artists and works are confusing or incomplete. I have been to many galleries and this was not one of the best in my opinion. On the other hand, the Pritti Palace is well worth the visit. The admission price is under 10 euros and the displays are well laid out and clearly marked. The gardens around the palace are superb and extensive. Also, there were no lineups and one could take one's time to visit the museum and the grounds.
reviews.title: Three positves, one negative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked all of our hotels, based soley on trip advisor reviews. Proved to be highly reliable source. Alba Hotel --was our first hotel experience in Italy.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in a lovely city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) We were so pleased with the old world charm of this hotel Our two story room totally reflected its Tuscan location..
reviews.title: Good but be prepared

likes.disliked: — street noise when opening a window

reviews.title: Very central hotel
reviews.text: 2) Convenient location could not be beat, with affordable eateries just one minute walk's away. We felt safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paid about $125 CDN per night via expedia. Close to the train station (walkable distance). Staff is very friendly and helpful. No free internet. Free continental breakfast was very good... with meat & cheese, fruit, cereal, buns. All tourist sites (markets, museums) are all walkable distance... bring good walking shoes! Rooms were very spacious, we had a newly renovated room and the colours were nice and everything was clean.
reviews.title: nice hotel for the price

likes.disliked: — a little bit noisy in the morning

reviews.text: An very nice hotel. We stayed a week and found the location to be excellent, close to the bus/train station and an easy walk to restaurants and the sights of Florence. The hotel has recently had an update so the rooms, bathrooms and breakfast room are all in excellent condition. The rooms, while small, are clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful in recommending local restaurants. The Il Latini restaurant is close by and should not be missed. The hotel provides an excellent breakfast with a wide variety of cereals, breads, meats and cheese. Considering the location, rooms and price this hotel offers very good value.
reviews.title: Great location, good hotel

reviews.text: I stayed just for 2 nights at the Hotel Alba in May . However , I have stayed there on 2 previous occasions , December 2005 , for 3 nights , and December 2004 , again for 3 nights , this time with my [ then ] 10 year old daughter . The hotel is superbly situated being just 2 minutes walk from the bus station and only 300 yards along Via Della Scala from Piazza Santa Maria Novella . All the major sights are within easy walking distance and there are numerous good Osterie and Trattorie in the vicinity . [ I recommend Osteria Belle Donne for some authentic Tuscan fare and ambience ! ] . There are also some nice friendly pubs nearby - my favourite being "Fiddlers Elbow " in the Piazza .In some guides you read that the area is a bit "seedy ". I have not found that to be accurate . I have been 7 times to Florence , often socialising in this area and have never felt unsafe or threatened in any way . The hotel itself is excellent value , not "posh " but clean , comfortable , and with a friendly and helpful staff . [ Out of season it is worthwhile e-mailing to ask for prices as the hotel will often accept reduced rates ] .
reviews.title: Alba is Ace !

likes.liked: — central location and friendliness and helpfulness of staff

reviews.text: We stayed at the Alba Hotel in Florence for three days. I was very disappointed. It was not at all like the pictures shown on the Expedia website. The room was very shabby, the bedspreads were worn and torn although the linen was clean and the bathroom was also clean. The bathroom was so small you could not close the pocket door without feeling like you were in a small closet. The shower was so small you could not move around in it comfortably. The breakfast was the same thing everyday and the food was not very fresh. They did not have room service and everytime you needed something, you had to go to the front desk to get it. We kept running out of toilet paper because the rolls were so small and we had to go down to the front desk to get it all the time. The area of the hotel was convenient to all the sights and shopping and restaurants but you did not feel to safe at night since it was right near the train terminal. I will say that the staff of the hotel were very nice and helped with whatever questions we had. I definitely would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Not What I Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel. The location is fantastic the rooms are very clean and spacious and the staff were friendly and helpful. The decoration is very warming and the breakfast room is really nice and bright. We had a great room with a balcony overlooking the breakfast room. There really isn’t anything to complain about. This hotel its great.
reviews.title: You have to stay here!

likes.liked: — Romantic decor, novelty paintings on walls, doors etc.
likes.disliked: — Theres nothing not to like, its great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The people at the front desk were first rate; the breakfast is excellent (try the yogurt) and the location is ideal for anyone using a train or bus.
reviews.title: Great location and front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights in the Alba Palace. The room was very clean, although a little crowded. It had a great location - only about 2 blocks from the train station and within walking distance of most of the major sites. The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful. The free breakfast was standard fare for a European hotel that caters to Americans. I would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the train station and right in the heart of Florence.We had a room on the 2nd floor at the front of the hotel and had no problem with noise. The room was spotless and cleaned thoroughly daily. There was plenty of choice for breakfast, cereals, fruit, bread and rolls, cold meats, cheeses, and best of all, pastries! The waitress running the dining room had to work hard clearing tables as well as topping up the food plates. She did this with a smile on her face and nothing was too much trouble for her. We arrived late in the evening but the receptionist was waiting for us and we were checked in very quickly and in no time walking down the road looking for our evening meal! There is a good pizza restaurant 100 metres along the road. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Perfect location.

reviews.text: Very close to train station. That is a huge plus. Everything is close to here. Breakfast is fine as well.
reviews.title: I would stay here again

reviews.text: Clean and modern. Great location and good breakfast. No street noise. Sound proof windows a great plus! Would stay there again!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room (001) was huge. We booked a double and got a room with a king bed + a loft with another king bed! The main room had no window. That was a major drawback. But the room was clean, the bed comfortable, not much space to put things, but very quiet. Silent in fact. (We saw another double on 2nd floor, This one had windows, but was tiny.) Our bathroom was wonderful. Great shower over huge tub. Buffet breakfast good: typical mix of meats, cheeses, rolls, yogurt, juices, cereals and coffee.. The lady working the room wasn't too swift clearing the tables after the guests left, and she didn't refill the food trays often enough. Altogether good value at €160. Friendly front desk. They had parking at nearby garage at €21 per night, a very good deal. My wife and I would probably try a different hotel if we ever return to Florence. Location ok. Not a beautiful street.
reviews.title: Good Value - Quiet

reviews.text: we stayed at the hotel alba for 3 days. it was a very pleasent stay, lovely room, friendly staff. It was very close to all the attractions and the station. The room we stayed in was beautiful and road outside was not as noisey as previous hotels we have stayed in in florence.
reviews.title: relax at the alba

reviews.text: We stayed at this great hotel for 3 nights at the end of Sept 2006. As other reviews have stated, the location is perfect....a few minutes walk from the train station, close to the major sites, Ponte Veccio and also had free internet access. We had a triple room (003), loft style with a huge jacuzzi tub in a room outside of the bathroom, great shower etc. The only negative was a musty smell in the room but we didn't spend much time in there anyway. We didn't find the staff to be overly helpful but we made do. I would also highly recommend the little resturant outside the hotel for lunch (La Grotta di Leo).
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: While most of the reviews for the Alba have been positive, I feel that none have gone far enough in its praise! I stayed here last week for three nights, and was completely charmed. As always when traveling alone, I fear the worst with single rooms, but mine was spacious, gorgeous, and immaculate--I mean, INSANELY clean!! I had a street-facing room on the 3rd floor which was completely quiet at night if the windows were closed. I heard nothing from anyone next to me or beneath my room--and I have extremely acute hearing.
reviews.title: Utterly Wonderful!

reviews.text: One of the best things was the bathroom, which is beautifully tiled and actually had GOOD light PLUS a magnifying mirror PLUS a wonderful shower. The walls were ragged or stippled yellow, giving a wonderful effect, and it was very light. The whole place felt much more spacious than your typical European hotel, including the breakfast room, reception area, and hallways. The glassed-in elevator would easily accommodate 10 and a boatload of luggage.
reviews.title: You must stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently visited Florence travelling from Scotland. The hotel had a good location, near to the station and a short walk to the Duomo. We had flown with Ryanair to Pisa, then bus to Florence, so it was great that the hotel was so near the station.
reviews.title: Scots in the Alba

likes.liked: — value for money and good location

reviews.title: small hotel. close to attractions
reviews.text: The room was on the first floor, and overlooked the courtyard. The lift was absolutely tiny, big enough for two or one person and a case. The room was pretty big, with a large bathroom but no bath. The air conditioning was good and kept the room cool enough for our needs - being Scottish we're used to the cold!

The room was kept spotlessly clean and towels changed each day. The only downside was the noise levels. The floors were laminate wood which meant noise travelled easily from floor to floor, and the walls must have been quite thin too. Facing the courtyard meant there was no noise from the street which was good for those who like a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Breakfast was in the covered courtyard and was pretty good. My husband loved the pots of coffee and steamed milk each morning and said they were very good. There was a great selection of meats, cheese, rolls, croissants, cakes, cereals and juices - just what you need to fill you up before a hard day sight-seeing.
reviews.title: Wish we had stayed longer!
quiet and lovely in the heart of Florence!
reviews.text: The front desk were very helpful, and provided a map with good information on what to see if you have a short time. All the staff were very friendly. We liked the piazza at the covered market, it was an ideal place to people watch over a drink or some lovely food. The market itself is also good for food gifts - packeted pasta etc, or for some nibbles for your room.

Found the Hotel Alba Palace when I was looking for a property for a friend and I to stay for several days while in Florence. The Hotel Alba Palace met all criteria for a reasonably priced, centrally located, non-smoking hotel, near the train station with a 24 hour front desk, lift, free WIFI, and in-room safe. This hotel was a great find. Our 2nd floor room was quiet (which we requested) and clean, with television and air conditioning (which we needed during the early October heat wave). It opened onto a beautiful courtyard atrium below which we could view the breakfast room. The bathroom was modern and also very clean with many large, fluffy towels. Although moderately priced, this hotel had some nice amenities. The breakfast was included in the room price and was excellent, with fresh fruit and yoghurts, breakfast breads and meats, and cereals and juices. The cappuccino was great! The staff at the hotel were very helpful at all levels, from restaurant recommendations, to tour booking, to printing out train schedules. We loved the 5 minute proximity to the Duomo and short walking distance to all major points of interest. Would stay here again and definitely recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Comfortable, good value, excellent breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room was very nice and comfortable. The washroom was cleaned very well every day and generally was without fault. The Hotel is very centrally located near (luggage dragging distance) the tarin station and easy walikng distance to all important museums,churches and shopping. The locale is very quiet and peaceful during the day and night.
reviews.title: Special Journey to Florence
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Staff was very helpful and polite. The breakfast staff even indulged our late arrival for breakfast which was very kind.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we would recommend this Hotel to anyone, as we enjoyed our stay on our 25th wedding celebration.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Alba Palace in early September 2011, and had a most enjoyable stay. We wanted a hotel close to the station and picked this hotel on the strength of TA reviews and availability. It is certainly an easy walk to SMN station, but the key attraction is the wonderful sense of quiet and space, and the ambience created from the conversion of three or so adjacent buildings into a modern and well-equipped hotel. Staff were universally helpful, and offered excellent restaurant recommendations.The room, although not large, was modern, spotless, air conditioned and well equipped. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Very happy with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, we found the staff helpfull at check in and the rooms clean although small. Normal for Europe.
reviews.title: Reasonable Hotel not far from the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was the worse we encountered in our Europe travels and hopefully they will inprove this in the future.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel largest breakfast

reviews.text: This by far was the best hotel we stayed in Italy. It was clean, had some cute unique features in the room and the common spaces and was in a safe central location. You are literally 2 blocks from the train station and a 5 min walk from the duomo. The breakfast was the largest we had in all of italy including cereal, yogurt, pastries, multiple kinds of coffee, an EGG!, meats, cheeses, and FRUIT! The staff was kind but didn't speak good english nor were they terribly helpful. Coffee was mediocre. (I'm a bit of a snob thought). We had lots of misquotes in our room and my husband keep waking up with itchy bumps. (It wasn't bed bugs we looked every night).
reviews.title: A wonderful bed and breakfast in Florence!!

reviews.text: I highly recommend Hotel Alba Palace. It was a pleasant surprise to see how extremely clean and modern the hotel rooms are, the staff is exceptional friendly (especially the night staff), they will provide a map and recommendations where to eat and make reservations for dinner or museums, the morning breakfast is wonderful, they will even make you expresso or cappuccino if you request at no charge, and they will rent you DVDs for no charge as well! A wonderful place to stay while traveling and the location is really great for walking to the train station and to all of the sights!
reviews.title: A great boutique hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Alba Palace in Florence in Oct 2011. We had a room for 3 and it was comfortable clean and the facility was very attractive. The breakfast area is a very eye catching glass covered courtyard where an extensive and tasty breakfast is served daily. The location was 1 1/2 block walk from the SMN train station and about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo. The staff was very friendly and helpful with good recommendations on dining. We will use the Alba again in the future. Bravo!
reviews.title: Great convenient hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Alba Palace was even better than I could have imagined starting with the inviting lobby, sunlit breakfast atrium, and continuing on to the spacious, comfortable, very clean, and warmly decorated rooms. Breakfast was above standard with lots of wonderful pastries, cheese, fruit, cereal, juices, and coffee. Situated just off of the Piazza Santa Maria Novella, the hotel is close to the train station, within walking distance to just about everything, and don't miss the used and rare book shops in the area between the hotel and the Arno. Wonderful restaurants are close by, we enjoyed Tira baralla, just down the street, and Tratorria al Trebbio was a favorite.
reviews.title: Hotel Alba Palace is lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our visit to Italy and Greece and we would HIGHLY recommend the Hotel Alba Palace in Florence! The staff was incredibly helpful and welcoming and they put us in an "upgrade" room that was quite a lovely surprise. We were placed in a room (I believe it was 002 or 003) that had a double sized jaccuzi, double shower, a second bedroom "balcony". It was definitely within our top 2 hotels of our stay out of the 6-7 we stayed in! Now, was it perfect? No, we couldn't figure out how to run the jets for the jacuzzi but we enjoyed the soak after the 7-8days of walking Italy previous, and one of the shower heads didn't flow properly, however we didn't care. Our only regret was that we were only able to stay one night because of our schedule. We are sure that the staff would have shown us how to use the jets and fixed the second shower head had we stayed more than one night. They showed us to a fabulous dinner (in fact our favorite of our ENTIRE trip, at "18 Gobbi", a MUST visit, favorite wine of the trip, staff very charming, the house special Rigatoni a MUST!) The hotel was quiet, the breakfast lovely, and it was within walking distance to everything! Fabulous all around! I'm sorry to hear others had an "adequate" experience. Maybe it is all in the outlook...We found it quite wonderful!!
reviews.title: A wonderful stay!

reviews.text: Location was great as we travelled by train and the hotel was only .5kms from the Santa Maria Novella train station. Breakfast was a traditional Italian breakfast of pastries, bread, cheese and ham! A great a little pizzeria across the road!
reviews.title: Hotel Alba Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice little hotel only 10 mins from the Duomo, very close to the train station and just next door to the beautiful Santa Novella church (definitely worth a visit). Room was clean and nicely decorated with a very clean, albeit small bathroom but with lovely big bath towels! We had a bottle of prosecco waiting for us with lovely chocolates - due to it being our wedding anniversary - so many thanks for that. Lovely breakfast room with a good selection of pastries, meats, cheeses, fruit etc etc. Staff booked us tickets for the Accademia which was great and meant we did not have to join the very long queue! Overall good base to enjoy wonderful Florence. The tiny roof terrace was a lovely vantage point to enjoy a terrific lightening storm whilst sipping the prosecco!!
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Good location. Indifferent staff. Rooms are large and clean but walls are paper thin so you can hear everything your neighbors are saying/doing. Breakfast is very basic. For the price I suspect you can find something else well located with a bit more value for money. Not a terrible experience but I won't return.
reviews.title: Adequate

description: Adjacent to the cloisters of Santa Maria Novella in the historical center of Florence, the three antique buildings surrounding the covered courtyard, now our breakfast room, offer you a welcoming corner in typical Florentine style. Florence Hotel Alba Palace has united comfort in an antique Florentine dwelling and the care for detail by its attentive staff with the aim of making this hotel an authentic angle of hospitality.
